title: far as it relates to Articles 6(1)(b), (1)(c) and (2)(m) thereof, hereby order as
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Statistics (Business Expenditure on
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Statistics (Business Expenditure on 

Research and Development Survey) Order 2022.
text_norm: 1 order may cited statistic (business expenditure research development survey) order 2022

title: far as it relates to Articles 6(1)(b), (1)(c) and (2)(m) thereof, hereby order as
heading: 2. (1) In this Order –
text_raw:
2. (1) In this Order – 

“R&D” means research and development; 

“Regulation” means Regulation (EU) 2019/2152 of the European Parliament 
and of the Council of 27 November 20191, as amended by Commission 
Delegated Regulation (EU) 2021/1704 of 14 July 20212; 

“survey” means the Business Expenditure on Research and Development 
Survey 2021/2022 that is conducted by the Central Statistics Office in order to 
obtain information on R&D, including for the purpose of compliance with the 
Regulation. 

(2) A word or expression that is used in this Order and also used in the 
Regulation has the same meaning in this Order as in the Regulation, except 
where the context otherwise requires.
text_norm: 2 (1) order - r mean research development regulation mean regulation (eu) 2019 2152 european parliament council 27 november 20191 amended commission delegated regulation (eu) 2021 1704 14 july 20212 survey mean business expenditure research development survey 2021 2022 conducted central statistic office order obtain information r including purpose compliance regulation (2) word expression used order also used regulation meaning order regulation except context otherwise requires

title: far as it relates to Articles 6(1)(b), (1)(c) and (2)(m) thereof, hereby order as
heading: 3. This Order applies to an undertaking that is classified for statistical
text_raw:
3. This Order applies to an undertaking that is classified for statistical 
purposes under any section of NACE Rev. 2 set out in Annex I to Regulation 
(EC) No. 1893/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 20 
December 20063, as amended by Regulation (EC) No. 295/2008 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 11 March 20084, Regulation (EU) 
No. 70/2012 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18 January 
20125 and Regulation (EU) 2019/1243 of the European Parliament and of the 
Council of 20 June 2019.6 

1 OJ No. L 327, 17.12.2019, p.1. 
2 OJ No. L 339, 24.9.2021, p. 33. 
3 OJ No. L 393, 30.12.2006, p.1. 
4 OJ No. L 97, 9.4.2008, p. 13. 
5 OJ No. L 32, 3.2.2012, p.1. 
6 OJ No. L 198, 25.7.2019, p.241. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 12th July, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4. A requirement on undertakings to which this Order applies to provide, 
once only and for the purposes of the survey, information the general nature of 
which is specified in the Schedule is hereby prescribed. 

[349] 3 

 
 
 
 4 [349]

title: far as it relates to Articles 6(1)(b), (1)(c) and (2)(m) thereof, hereby order as
heading: Article 4
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

Article 4 

Information regarding the following, as it relates to the undertaking
text_norm: schedule article 4 information regarding following relates undertaking

title: far as it relates to Articles 6(1)(b), (1)(c) and (2)(m) thereof, hereby order as
heading: concerned:
text_raw:
1. 
concerned: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

the nature of its business activity insofar as it relates to 
R&D in 2021; 

expenditure on in-house R&D activity in 2021; 

estimated expenditure on in-house R&D activity in 
2022; 

sources of funds for in-house R&D activity performed in 
2021 and the amount in euro from each source 
concerned; 

categories of in-house R&D activity performed in 2021 
and the expenditure on each category concerned; 

the number of persons involved in in-house R&D 
activity in 2021 including, in relation to each such 
person, his or her role, qualifications and gender and the 
amount of time spent by him or her on that activity; 

R&D activity at local unit level in 2021; 

expenditure on R&D activity performed on behalf of the 
undertaking by other persons in 2021; 

by reference to the qualifications of the persons 
concerned, whether the undertaking is likely, in the 
period commencing on 1 January 2022 and ending on 31 
December 2027, to increase the number of persons 
involved in in-house R&D activity; 

(j) 

engagement in 2021 by the undertaking with other 
persons in joint R&D projects.
